OFFICE OF STATE TAX COMMISSIONER LINCOLN, NEBRASKA. LETTER OF TRANSMITTAL December 1, 1942 Honorable Dwight Griswold, Governor of Nebraska, Lincoln. My dear Governor: Herewith is transmitted the Twenty-second Annual Report of the State Tax Commissioner and the State Board of Equaliza - tion and Assessment for the year 1942. This report contains numerous statements and supporting schedules listed in the Table of Contents. I wish to take this opportunity to express my apprecia - tion for the co-operation of yourself and the other members of the State Board of Equalization and Assessment, also the fine co-operation and valuable help given by the Attorney General's office. I wish to express my thanks to the county assessors, county clerks and other county officials to whom it has been necessary to make frequent re - quests for advice and assistance. The following statement should be of interest,, as it shows the comparative assessed values for 1941 and 1942, revealing an increase in the Intangible "A" and "B", notwithstanding the heavy pur - chase of tax exempt securities by the general public. STATEMENT NO. 5 ROLLING STOCK ASSESSMENT The rolling stock assessment of the various railroads is made by the State Board of Equalization and Assessment in accordance -with .Section 77-616, Compiled Statutes of Nebraska for 1929. The amount so found is divided by the total number of miles, giving the total valu - ation per mile, and this amount is multiplied by the number of miles in each city or village. This amount is then certified to the County Clerk to be added to the assessment of terminal property which is made by the local assessor and then equalized by the State Board. REPORT OF TAX COMMISSIONER STATEMENT NO. 6 THE PULLMAN COMPANY 1942 Assessment Sleeping Car Companies are assessed by the State Board of Equal - ization and Assessment. REPORT OF TAX COMMISSIONER STATEMENT NO. 9 BASIS FOR 1942 STATE TAX LEVY The report of the State Auditor shows appropriations from the state general fund for the biennial period of 1941-1943 to be ..._ $ 11.351,292.16 One-half of which is to be raised from revenues from the general fund in 1942, and is _ $ 5,675,646.08 Less available for general fund: Intangible Tax - $138,165.24 Plus miscellaneous collections 794,779.32 To be paid by Consumers Public Power District in lieu of taxes 34,017.46 $ 966,992.02 Net appropriations lo be met $ 4,708,654.06 Which amount is increased 3.6% in accordance with Sec. 77-1007, Compiled Statutes of Nebraska for 1929 _ $ 169,511.55 Total to he raised by 1942 general fund levy $ 4,878,165.61 The valuation of the state for taxation purposes has been found to be _ $ 2,042,442,436.00 Applied to which a levy of 2.39 mills will raise $ 4,881,437.42 Therefore the foregoing levy is hereby approved by the State Board of Equalization and Assessment this 30th. day of July, 1942. REPORT OF TAX COMMISSIONER STATEMENT NO. 13 STATE ESTATE TAX The State Estate Tax Law, enacted in 1929, is administered by the State Tax Commissioner. The basis for the tax due is eighty per cen - tum of the Federal Estate Tax less credit for any succession or inheri - tance taxes paid to any County Treasurer for a county or counties in the State of Nebraska. This tax applies only to estates of resident decedents, valued at $100,000 or more. REPORT OF TAX COMMISSIONER STATEMENT NO. 18 1942 MUNICIPAL TAX RATES The following report shows the population, assessed valuation, the various tax rates, and the total thereof, as well as the total taxes in each of the 527 incorporated municipalities in Nebraska, and also the tax rate in 9 unincorporated towns, four of which are county seat towns. The total tax has been determined by applying the total tax rate to the valuation, rather than from the footings of the tax list. The data has been compiled Srom reports made by the County Clerks to the State Tax Commissioner. The following towns are in more than one county: Emerson is in three counties—Dakota, Dixon and Thurston. Ox - ford is in Harlan and Furnas; Tilden is in Antelope and Madison; Trumbull is in Adams and Clay and Wakefield is in Dixon and Wayne Counties. * County Seat. Township levy is not included.
